thread.title: Halloween is coming, Cheyenne has plenty to "boo"
thread.title_full: Halloween is coming, Cheyenne has plenty to "boo"

title: Halloween is coming, Cheyenne has plenty to "boo"
text: Legal Information Halloween is coming, Cheyenne has plenty to "boo" October represents so many things, but nothing is as important as Halloween. Here is a partial list of the events in Cheyenne and the surrounding area to help you have a spook-tacular Halloween. Crafts, costume parties and candy - we've got it all right here. Updated on Oct. 10. Create your own crayons from spooky colors all melted together. When: Oct. 11, 1 p.m. Where: Children's Village at the Cheyenne Botanic Gardens, 616 S. Lions Park Drive Cost: $1 per child Contact: www.botanic.org or 637-6349 STRESS MONSTERS Learn about the benefits that herbs and aromatherapy can have on our health. Create a scent-filled monster to take home When: Oct. 13, 4 p.m. Where: Children's Village at the Cheyenne Botanic Gardens, 616 S. Lions Park Drive Cost: $1 per child Contact: www.botanic.org or 637-6349 HAUNTED TREEHOUSE SCULPTURES Create Halloween art with a tree branch as your base for a miniature haunted tree house diorama. When: Oct. 14, 4 p.m. Where: Children's Village at the Cheyenne Botanic Gardens, 616 S. Lions Park Drive Cost: $1 per child Take home the seeds to roast for a seasonal treat. When: Oct. 18, 1 p.m. Where: Children's Village at the Cheyenne Botanic Gardens, 616 S. Lions Park Drive Cost: $1 per child THE ROOT OF ALL EVIL, HALLOWEEN DOLLS Harvest fibrous root plants and sunflowers, upend them and make miniature scarecrow decorations When: Oct. 21, 4 p.m. Where: Children's Village at the Cheyenne Botanic Gardens, 616 S. Lions Park Drive Cost: $1 per child Find treats, play games and take part in a cakewalk. Cookies and punch. When: Oct. 24, 11 a.m.-1 p.m. Where: Christ Lutheran Church and AKIDemy, 3260 Nationway Cost: Free MINI PUMPKIN PAINTING Come learn fun facts about the season's favorite fruit as you paint a mini pumpkin to take home. When: Oct. 25, 1 p.m. Where: Children's Village at the Cheyenne Botanic Gardens, 616 S. Lions Park Drive Cost: $1 per child Contact: www.botanic.org or 637-6349 GRAVEYARD DIRT CUPS Learn about the benefits of worms in the garden and snack on a squirmy, wiggly, gritty and delicious dirt cup (Oreo cups filled with Jell-O worms). When: Oct. 22, 4 p.m. Where: Children's Village at the Cheyenne Botanic Gardens, 616 S. Lions Park Drive Cost: $1 per child Blend into your surroundings while being outstanding in your leaf mask. When: Oct. 28, 4 p.m. Where: Children's Village at the Cheyenne Botanic Gardens, 616 S. Lions Park Drive Cost: $1 per child Contact: www.botanic.org or 637-6349 HAUNTED HOUSE: MASTERS OF MISERY Make your way through the spookified corridors at Sigma Alpha Epsilon in Laramie, with early sessions for kids, late-night sessions for adults. When: Oct. 29: From 7-8 p.m. the haunted house will be open to kids; from 8 p.m.-midnight, it will be open to adults. Oct. 30-31: from 6-8 p.m., it will be open to kids, from 8 p.m.-1 a.m., it will be open to adults. Where: Sigma Alpha Epsilon, 1621 E. Fraternity Row, Laramie. Cost: $5; all proceeds go to Cathedral Home for Children. Contact: 801 -310-7380 or butler@uwyo.edu HALLOWEEN FUN AT THE YMCA Maze, haunted house, inflatables, games, photo booth and food. There will also be a costume content with prizes awarded for Best Family Theme, Most Creative, Most Authentic and Over-all Best Costume. When: Oct. 30, 1-3 p.m. Where: Cheyenne Family YMCA, 1426 E. Lincolnway Cost: $1 a person Contact: 634-9622 GOBLIN WALK Wear your costume and collect treats and prizes from your favorite superheroes, monsters and movie characters. Geared for those ages 2-8. When: Oct. 30, 1:30-3:30 p.m. and 5:30-8:30 p.m. Where: Youth Activity and Community Center, 1317 Parsley Blvd. Cost: $6 per person, ages 1 and under free Contact: 637-6423 Face paintings, watch a pumpkin science experiment and take home a pumpkin When: Oct. 30, 2-4 p.m. Where: Second floor, Laramie County Library, 2200 Pioneer Ave. Contact: www.laramiecountylibrary.org or 634-3561 THE SPOOKY SIDE OF SPACE There are lots of scary looking things and spooky stories about space, but science can be used to learn more about these objects and they will become a lot less scary. Kids are encouraged to come dressed in costume for this Halloween show and receive a special prize at the door. When: Oct. 31, 11 a.m. Where: Harry C. Vaughan Planetarium, basement of the Physical Sciences Building, University of Wyoming, Laramie. Cost: $3 students, $4 for non-students. Contact: www.uwyo.edu/physics , 307-766-6150 or physics@uwyo.edu A NIGHT AT THE MUSEUM Explore the museum and meet important characters from Wyoming's history When: Oct. 31, 4-7 p.m. Where: Wyoming State Museum, 2301 Central Ave. Contact: 777-7022 Children can find treats in the trunk of each vehicle circling the east parking lot. When: Oct. 31, 4-6 p.m. Where: Highlands Presbyterian Church, 2390 Pattison Ave. Contact: Rev. Rodger McDaniel rmc81448@gmail.com TRICK OR TREAT AT THE GOVERNOR'S RESIDENCE Although Gov. Matt Mead and first lady Carol Mead won't be available, they still would like to invite trick or treaters to stop by for a treat. When: Oct. 31, 5-7 p.m. Where: 5001 Central Ave. TRICK OR TREAT AT FRONTIER MALL Parents can bring their children to Frontier Mall for lots of goodies at participating retailers When: Oct. 31, 5-7 p.m. Where: Frontier Mall, 1400 Dell Range Contact: 638-2290 Fun, safe Halloween alternative for families, including a trunk or treat, games, etc. When: Oct. 31, 6-7:30 p.m. Where: Little Lambs Preschool parking lot, 4776 Mountain Road Contact: Stephanie Heitsch, 633-7525 For adults NIGHTMARE ON 17TH STREET A haunted house presented by The Knights of Pythias. No one under 8 will be admitted. Blackout night is Oct. 29. When: Oct. 10, 16-17, 23-24, 30-31, 7-11 p.m. Where: 312 1/2 W. 17th St. Cost: $10 Contact: 222-5412 GHOST TOURS OF LARAMIE CITY Take a hayride through downtown Laramie followed by a candlelight tour of the Historic Territorial Prison. Hear spooky stories that are, allegedly, based in truth. When: Oct. 16, Oct. 23-24, Oct. 29-31 Where: Tours leave every half hour from 7-9:30 p.m. Where: Downtown Laramie and the Wyoming Territorial Prison. Tickets: $15 adults, $10 for children 10 and under. Contact: 307-760-8835 TROLLEY FRIGHTSEEING TOURS Board the trolley bus and settle in for tales of spooks, spirits and paranormal happenings that occurred in Cheyenne. Not recommended for young children. When: Oct. 17, 23-25, 29-30 Where: Tours depart from Capitol Avenue in front of Cheyenne Depot Plaza. Cost: $12 for adults, $6 for children under 12. Tickets must be purchased in advance. Contact: Visit Cheyenne at 778-3133 CHEYENNE BOO-TIFICATION BALL Costume party featuring dinner, dancing to DJ music and a silent auction. Proceeds will purchase public game tables for Cheyenne Depot Plaza. When: Oct. 24, 6 p.m. Where: Holiday Inn, 204 W. Fox Farm Road Cost: $60
